telegramBot.title: How to Create a Telegram Bot
telegramBot.step1Description: Search for "@BotFather" in Telegram (official bot for creating bots)
telegramBot.step2Description: Start a chat with BotFather and send the /newbot command
telegramBot.step3Title: Choose a name for your bot
telegramBot.step3Description: Example: "My Support Bot" (this is the display name users will see)
telegramBot.step5Description: BotFather will give you a token like: "1234567890:ABCdefGHIjklMNOpqrsTUVwxyz"
telegramBot.step5Highlight: IMPORTANT: Keep this token secret! It's like a password for your bot.

telegramGroup.title: How to Find Telegram Group ID
telegramGroup.step1Title: Add your bot to the Telegram group
telegramGroup.step1Description: Go to your Telegram group ‚Üí Group Info ‚Üí Add Members ‚Üí Search for your bot and add it
telegramGroup.step2Description: Group Info ‚Üí Administrators ‚Üí Add Administrator ‚Üí Select your bot
telegramGroup.step3Title: Option A: Use a bot to get the ID
telegramGroup.step3Description: Add @getidsbot to your group. It will automatically send the group ID.
telegramGroup.step4Description: Send a message in the group, then visit: https://api.telegram.org/bot<YourBotToken>/getUpdates
telegramGroup.step5Description: The ID will look like: -1001234567890 (starts with -100)

embedWidget.title: How to Embed the Widget on Your Website
embedWidget.step1Description: After creating your bot, you'll receive an embed code snippet
embedWidget.step2Description: Open your website's HTML file and paste the code just before the closing </body> tag
embedWidget.step3Description: Go to Settings ‚Üí Custom Code/Scripts ‚Üí Paste in Footer section
embedWidget.step4Description: Add the script to your _document.js, _app.js, or index.html file
embedWidget.step5Description: Refresh your website and you should see the chat widget in the bottom-right corner
